description.narrative: Partnering for building a national Platform to support the Government to nationalize, implement and monitor the Sustainable Development Goals.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1. The capacities of the SDG Secretariat (ERI) in VNR development strengthened 1.2. Number of new stakeholders from the civil society and private sector actively engaged in the work of the 5 inter-ministerial WGs and wider in the SDG Platform operationalization 2.1 Number of SDGs targets mainstreamed into the existing and/or emerging national development programs and in the national annual financial plans 2.2. Number of specialists trained in methods to integrate SDGs into national planning 2.3. Number of national and regional plans incorporating environment- and gender-specific SDG targets such as achieving the three SGD 16 indicators 3.1 Number of specialists in sectoral ministries and authorities that own statistical tools for data processing and analysis 3.2. Number of baseline measurement, including validation of available baselines, level of disaggregation and methodologies for the SDGs established 3.3. Number of indicators related to gender equality and women’s empowerment for availability of baselines and methodology 4.1. Number of specialists trained in innovative methods of financing SDGs 4.3 Number of professionals with knowledge of international commitments in the area of financing of the global Agenda 2030

comment.narrative: The need for enhanced data, monitoring and reporting capacity, for establishing baselines for targets and indicators for each SDG, and for compiling disaggregated national and subnational level data. Concretely, to introduce the SDGs targets and indicators in the planning of sectoral programs

1) Provided technical expertise and organized inclusinve workshops to implement the main prinicple of Agenda 2030 Leave no one behind in VNR preparation. Supported ERI in proofreading and translation of the VNR in English language and printing of 1,050 copies of the VNR, which was successfully presented on the HLPF in New York in July 2019. 2) Organized participation of the MNE in the second global workshop for the 2019 VNR countries that were held in Bonn, on 19-20 February, 2019 3) Organized a First Forum on Sustainable Development on the auspices of the XII Astana Economic Forum. 4) Organized trips to 17 regions of Kazakhstan of the ERI team to apply the tool Imagine 2030 developed by colleagues from RCO in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The tool allowed to identify problems in the regions and proposed solutions by the citizens of thet regions. This data will serve as a basis for further localization of the SDGs 5) The work is ongloing. Supporting with technical expertise on identifying the methodology on SDG16 indicators. Conducted an extensive 2 day workshop with IRH expert Mr. Mihail Peleah and members of the ComStat woring group to idenity the baseline and methodologies for calculation of SDG 16 indicators; Organized a 2 day workshop on ecological indicators with participation of collleagues from UNEP and UNECE on 21-22 November 2019; Participants of the workshop (members of the ComStat) working group identified ways on how to approach ecological indicators and reflect in their reporting. 6) Hired local consultancy firm to provide analytical report with recommendations on the RIA of national budget and 2 dimensions of the DFA in Kazakhstan. The ToR also includes promotion of the DFA exercise and trainings to stakeholders. Conducted a 1 day workshop for the representatives of the Ministry of Finance and Ministry of Economy to intorduce them to the work being done in Kazakhstan on DFA and RIA of national budget to get a buy-in from the Government. The exercise will be continued next year with a support of the Goverbnment of Kazakhstan, since they understood the importance of the SDG Finance concept to achieve SDGs by 2030; Additionally, In partnership with MNE and ADB, UNDP organized and hold a First Regional SDG Summit in November 2019, in Almaty UN House. The Summit was dedicated to the topic of Mobilizing finance to achieve SDGs. The Summit gathered more than 300 participants, including CSOs, private sector and experts who shared their experience and ideas on financing SDGs. Also, the Summit was attended by government officials from Azerbaijan, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan.
